metadata.title: CVE-2017-8871 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The cr_parser_parse_selector_core function in cr-parser.c in libcroco0.6.12 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loopand CPU consumption) via a crafted CSS file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8871` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcroco-tools - 0.6.8-2ubuntu1+esm1
libcroco3 - 0.6.8-2ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libcroco package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.6.8-2ubuntu1+esm1').
